oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tennessee Theatre on Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 1952
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Interior and exterior views of the historic Tennessee Theater (527 Church Street), located in the Sudekum Building, circa 1952. This palatial Art Deco movie palace opened on February 28th, 1952. It featured a 2,000-seat auditorium adjoining the Sudekum Building (Warner Building). This new portion of the building was done by Marr & Holman, architects and Foster-Creighton, General Contractors. The theatre sign was nine stories high. Both the theatre and Sudekum Building were razed in the late 1980s to make way for a new highrise. The Foster & Creighton construction contracting firm was founded in 1885 by Wilbur F. Foster and Robert T. Creighton, who had both served as City Engineer of Nashville. Forms part of the Foster & Creighton General Contractors Collection. 19 b & w photographs.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Tennessee Theatre (Nashville, Tenn.); Sudekum Building (Nashville, Tenn.); Warner Building (Nashville, Tenn.); Watkins Building (Nashville, Tenn.)
